Articles.Content:
On 5/28/2024 at 11:18 AM, BA-Forums said:

Mars Transfer Vehicle, I need names for it.


(This is also part of the phoenix missions)

Ah, coming up with names. The harder part of KSP no one talks about.

Here are some ideas: 

Hermes (yes just a ripoff of the Martian but still)

Mercury (the Roman version)

Pheonix (this one is dependent on your taste, whether or not the ship should be named after the mission)

Firebird (old school)

Prince Ivan (my personal favorite, after the protagonist of the Firebird story in Slavic folklore)

What's the ship like? That could help.

Edited June 4 by Kimera Industries
A NEW PAGE was discovered today. You'll never believe how it... [click to read more]

Ah, coming up with names. The harder part of KSP no one talks about.

Here are some ideas:

What's the ship like? That could help.

I like these names, and I’ll use a few of those as I am going to be using cycler spacecraft. The spacecraft was supposed to use a nuclear engine but I saw that new Scott Manley video on how those work and I don’t want to irradiate Socks Heeler, who is one of the crew members on the mission 

I *MIGHT* still use one because you just have to maneuver carefully or just use a crap ton of shielding
I improved the Hab for the phoenix missions

very WIP


IXV Hail Mary extending its tether centrifuge

for some reason the most detailed part of the model (currently) is the tether ropes, it's got modeled strands and stuff

I improved the Hab for the phoenix missions

A cool detail might be to, when drawing the surface equipment, landed vessels, the hab, etc., the outside is stained with Martian regolith. It adds a little bit of extra detail since they're probably being exposed to some minor dust storms over the mission.

Socks Heeler, Mission Specialist. 
Socks is an Australian mechanical engineer and botanist who hails from Brisbane. She is the first Australian astronaut to set foot on the Red Planet. 

Edited June 7 by BA-Forums
Socks’ hand was missing…

Here’s drawing of the Philadelphia skyline I spent quite a few days making. This is an actual place in Philly too, I literally just zoomed in on some random spot on Google Earth, and then just copied it down.

After a bit of time not drawing, I have returned. Don’t ask about the pigeons that got melted to make this communications uplink work.


this is a rough sketch so there are editing notes on it!

On 6/28/2024 at 9:41 PM, BA-Forums said:

 

After a bit of time not drawing, I have returned. Don’t ask about the pigeons that got melted to make this communications uplink work.


this is a rough sketch so there are editing notes on it!

I like the "DSN Magic." Maybe they have an ansible.

13 hours ago, Kimera Industries said:

I like the "DSN Magic." Maybe they have an ansible.

Yes. The ANSAT system (Ansible Satellite) is a large communications satellite system that has three satellites located in a geosynchronous orbit over earth, and three over Mars. 
 

ANSAT works by sending a signal from a source (ie, a webcam and microphone attached to a TV) to the nearest DSN station. This signal will be then amplified with the ANSAT-Ground antenna, which is strong enough to melt pigeons in a direct transmission. Direct transmissions will suffer from time lag, so live video chats use the ANSAT satellite in geosynchronous to fire the signal like a fighter jet launching from an aircraft carrier. this is done in ways that I need to come up with. The signal goes FTL, and it gets caught by the ANSAT, like that same fighter jet catching the arresting cable on the carrier, in Martian orbit and transmitted down to the Hab.

 

internet can also be used on the Martian surface, using ANSAT as a earth transmitter for instantaneous communication, with Starlink and a prototype system created by Lockheed Martin used as the routers.


I just came up with that lol
